title: The Transfiguration and Teachings
shortSummary: Mark chapter 9 presents the powerful Transfiguration of Jesus, revealing His divine glory to Peter, James, and John. The chapter also includes Jesus’ teachings on faith, humility, spiritual warfare, and the cost of discipleship, emphasizing the necessity of prayer, belief, and servanthood in the Christian life.
timeline: c. AD 28-30 - Ministry of Jesus in Galilee

keyCharacters.name: Jesus
keyCharacters.description: The Son of God who reveals His divine nature through the Transfiguration, teaches about faith and humility, and demonstrates authority over evil spirits.

keyCharacters.name: Peter
keyCharacters.description: One of Jesus’ closest disciples who witnesses the Transfiguration and struggles to understand Jesus’ teachings.

keyCharacters.name: James
keyCharacters.description: A disciple of Jesus, present at the Transfiguration and part of the inner circle of followers.

keyCharacters.name: John
keyCharacters.description: Another of Jesus’ closest disciples, present at the Transfiguration and involved in the discussions about spiritual authority.

keyCharacters.name: The Father (Voice from the Cloud)
keyCharacters.description: God the Father who affirms Jesus as His beloved Son during the Transfiguration.

definitions.definition: The event where Jesus’ appearance was gloriously transformed, revealing His divine nature to select disciples.
Another name for the prophet Elijah, who appeared with Moses during the Transfiguration.
A demon or evil spirit causing muteness and physical torment, referenced in the healing of the possessed boy.
A large stone used for grinding grain, symbolizing severe judgment when mentioned as a metaphor for causing others to sin.
The quality of salt to preserve and add flavor, used metaphorically to describe Christian character and influence.

outline.heading: The Transfiguration of Jesus
outline.description: Jesus reveals His divine glory on a high mountain to Peter, James, and John, accompanied by Moses and Elijah, and affirmed by God’s voice from a cloud, strengthening the disciples’ faith.

outline.heading: Jesus Explains Elijah’s Coming and Suffering
outline.description: Jesus clarifies the fulfillment of prophecy regarding Elijah and foretells His own suffering and rejection, preparing the disciples for His death and resurrection.

outline.heading: Healing of the Boy with a Dumb Spirit
outline.description: Jesus heals a boy possessed by a demon after His disciples fail, teaching the necessity of faith, prayer, and fasting in spiritual battles.

outline.heading: Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection
outline.description: Jesus again foretells His betrayal, death, and resurrection, though the disciples do not fully understand His words.

outline.heading: Teaching on Greatness and Receiving Children
outline.description: Jesus teaches humility and servanthood, using a child as an example of the attitude required to be great in God’s kingdom.

outline.heading: Warning Against Hindering Believers and the Cost of Discipleship
outline.description: Jesus instructs His disciples to accept those who do good in His name, warns against causing others to sin, and emphasizes the seriousness of sin and the need for self-discipline.

application: Trust in God’s power through faith and persistent prayer, especially when facing spiritual challenges.
Embrace humility and serve others selflessly, following Jesus’ example to be great in God’s kingdom.
Be vigilant against sin and its consequences, taking serious steps to avoid anything that causes spiritual harm.
Encourage and support fellow believers who act in Jesus’ name, recognizing the unity of God’s work beyond personal boundaries.

keyVerses.text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms Jesus’ divine sonship and authority, calling believers to listen and obey Him.

keyVerses.text: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the essential role of faith in experiencing God’s power and miracles.

keyVerses.text: And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all.
keyVerses.significance: This teaching reverses worldly views of greatness, emphasizing humility and service as true Christian virtues.

keyVerses.text: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.
keyVerses.significance: It calls believers to maintain their distinctiveness and godly character, fostering peace within the community.
